text:
Welcome to howtocookthat.net I am ANn Reardon
today we are looking at the second part of

how to pipe buttercream flowers using only
a ziploc bag.

FOr the buttercream recipes there is a link
just below this video that will take you to

the website where you can get lemon buttercream,
chocolate buttercream even banana and coconut
buttercream recipes.

They are all there we will look at how to
do the mini daisies, how to do the big full

bloom roses and how to pipe the rose leaves
as you can see here and how to do the big
daisies as well so lets get started.

First of all apply your base colors that can
be anything that you'd like if it provides

a nice contrast for your flowers then that
looks good, here we are just putting some
chocolate on.

Take you ziploc bag fold the corner over and
then just cut out a square shape it will be

once it is opened but a small triangle is
what you are cutting out of the edge there

so that you can see that clearly I have drawn
on an envelope there what that cut should

look like so cut out that triangle
which when you open it up becomes a square,

place your buttercream in your bag, shake
it down to the bottom and then twist it so
it doesn't come out the top when you squeeze.

And so that's what it should look like once
you start squeezing.

Turn your hand all the way to one direction
and the start squeezing and spin the cupcake

as you do keep spinning it around and then
you can just twist back the other way and
pull up to finish.

And there you have a quick and easy buttercream
rose so spin all the way one direction as

far as your hand will go keep squeezing the
whole time then twist it back the other way

and when you're finished just lift up and
there is your full buttercream rose.

To make the large daisy using the exact same
cut on the bag just squeeze lift up turn squeeze

lift up turn squeeze lift up turn and then
place a lolly or m&M of your choice in the

middle of the daisy again so that you can
see squeeze lift, squeeze lift, squeeze lift

and place a lolly in the middle and you'r
done simple daisy.

Next the mini daisy again the same cut the
same thing just don't squeeze it quite so

hard so that you don't get so much icing out
so with the one cut in your bag you can do

three different flowers, three different cupcake
quickly and easily and then just use a mini

m&m in the middle of each one and you've got
a pretty little cupcake ready to go.

Next we will see how to make the rose petals
just take your piping bag and cut a small

notch out of one side of the corner just like
I ma showing you here on the paper so that
you can see it.

Then with the plastic on the top push and
pull back, if you don't want your leaf to

have the vein effect then you can just push
and pull back but if you want it to have the

vein effect then wiggle it back and forth
like I was showing you there.

Show you that in slow motion so applying constant
pressure to the bag just squeeze out some

icing in out in out in out and that will give
you the vein effect to your rose leaves.

Thank you to everyone who has subscribed to
this channel and clicked like and left comments

I really appreciate your support, if you've
got any questions leave them in the comments

below, and I'll do my best to answer them
for you don't forget to watch the other buttercream

flowers video if you haven't seen that one
yet you can see how to make the rose buds

the chrysanthemums and the camellias, or the
chocolate decorations video plenty more to
see if you click on the channel link.
